title: How to Make Chocolate Chip Pumpkin Bread

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 350ºF/175ºC.
steps.description: Grease and flour the loaf pans.

steps.headline: In a large bowl, combine sugar, pumpkin, oil, water, vanilla extract and eggs.
Add the cinnamon, nutmeg, baking soda and salt to the flour and stir with a whisk to break up any lumps.
Add the dry ingredients to the pumpkin mixture in batches, blending after each addition until combined.
steps.description: Gently fold in chocolate chips and nuts (if desired).

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into the prepare baking pans.
Bake for approximately 1 hour, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove pans from the oven and allow to cool for about 5 minutes.
Remove bread from pans and cool on wire racks.
steps.description: Do not allow it to completely cool in the pan, as it will become soggy.

text: Preheat oven to 350ºF/175ºC. Grease and flour the loaf pans. In a large bowl, combine sugar, pumpkin, oil, water, vanilla extract and eggs. Beat until smooth. Add the cinnamon, nutmeg, baking soda and salt to the flour and stir with a whisk to break up any lumps.  Add the dry ingredients to the pumpkin mixture in batches, blending after each addition until combined. Gently fold in chocolate chips and nuts (if desired). Pour the mixture into the prepare baking pans. Place in the oven. Bake for approximately 1 hour, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.  Remove pans from the oven and allow to cool for about 5 minutes.  Remove bread from pans and cool on wire racks. Do not allow it to completely cool in the pan, as it will become soggy.
